text: The voiced palatal implosive is a type of consonantal sound, used in some spoken languages. The symbol in the International Phonetic Alphabet that represents this sound is , and the equivalent X-SAMPA symbol is `J\_<`. Typographically, the IPA symbol is a dotless lowercase letter j with a horizontal stroke (the symbol for the voiced palatal stop) and a rightward hook (the diacritic for implosives). A very similar looking letter, (an with a tail), is used in Ewe for . ==Features== Features of the voiced palatal implosive: ==Occurrence== {| class="wikitable" !colspan=2| Language !! Word !! IPA !! Meaning !!
